function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Interpersonal transmission risks due to inadequate indoor and outdoor points of interest pois in proportion to resident density and demands.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Travel-related risks for vulnerable communities due to lack of job opportunities near neighborhoods and insufficient support for active transportation.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of affordable housing with resilient building typologies in dense areas, leading to spatial disparities transportation modes in relation to generalized biking and walking behaviors","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Correlation between accessible shopping mall area and lower disease case rates in lower-income communities","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Direct link between spatial allocations of points of interest and infection rate","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Long commute time by public transit as a concern for urban attribute","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Total viral load and risk of inhaling infectious aerosols increase with time spent in confined space","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of flexible mobility choices for long-distance travelers on public transit","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential ramifications of overcrowding in apartment buildings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of data and evidence relating architectural parameters to pandemic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High residential building density may facilitate disease transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High office and retail risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate covid-19 testing capacity in the early days of the pandemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Less predictable human longer public transport commute time are associated with higher disease case rates dcr .","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Crowded living conditions, particularly within young and low-income communities, may impair pandemic resilience.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited accommodation of active mobility as alternative commute modes may impact urban resilience to pandemics.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lower-income population residing in low-rent areas","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pt commute time positively correlates with dcr in p3.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential multicollinearity in mlr
